result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Anthony

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Justin Anthony in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Justin Anthony.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Klein provides an update; she needs additional time to try to resolve the matter with the State.  Atty. Klein requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:36 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Anthony in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Justin Anthony.  Atty. Klein provides an update; she has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  State will forward the offer to Atty. Klein today.  Atty. Klein requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State. Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Appointing Atty. Klein as counsel of record.

3:28 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Justin Anthony in court.  Court inquires if an offer has been provided to the defendant.  State advises this is the first appearance since the initial appearance, so an offer has not been prepared yet.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he was evaluated and qualifies for a Pubic Defender but one has not been appointed yet.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

08:51 AM Defendant Justin Anthony in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
